ResponseData.Description: The Mahindra Bolero Power+ is a sub-4-metre SUV. It gets a classy honey-comb mesh grille on the front with The Blue Vision headlamps inspired by hawk eyes on either side. Under the grille, the Bolero Power+ gets a front bumper that slopes inwards. On the sides, the Bolero Power+ gets contemporary body decals that complement the colour on the doors. The SUV gets black footrests on the sides. It uses 15-inch alloy wheels that enhance the side profile. The rear door on the Bolero Power+ opens sideways to make it easier for passengers occupying the jump seats to enter and exit. The rear door also houses the spare wheel. The rectangular tail lamps are located at the bottom on either side of the rear door.

The Mahindra Bolero Power+ is powered by the 1.5 three-cylinder mHAWKD70 diesel engine that generates 70PS of power and 195Nm of torque between 1,400-2,200rpm. Sufficient torque at lower rpm gives the SUV sufficient pulling-power and results in lower fatigue due to gear shifting. It is mated to a 5-speed manual gearbox. The Bolero Power+ gets the micro-hybrid system which helps the SUV generate a mileage of over 16kmpl. The SUV gets independent suspension with coil springs in the front and a leaf spring arrangement in the rear.

The Mahindra Bolero Power+ gets beige interiors. The dashboard is made with hard plastic with faux wood inserts on the centre console and the AC vents. The three-spoke steering wheel gets a hint of silver. The elongated instrument cluster extends from the steering wheel to the end of the central console on which the music system is placed. The thin pillars along with the large windows make the SUV feel roomy. The middle row gets a drop-down centre armrest. The jump seats can be folded up for additional storage space.

The Mahindra Bolero Power+ gets features like air-conditioner, music system with AUX, USB and CD. It also supports Bluetooth functionality. The Driver Information System provides details and alerts on open doors, fuel economy, distance to empty and other vital information. The Voice Messaging System provides information and alerts like seat belt warning, door open warning and low fuel warning among others. The Bolero+ gets a remote fuel lid opener that allows opening the fuel hatch while refuelling without leaving the vehicle. The cabin has been designed in such a way that the engine and tyre noise will not be audible even at high speeds.

The Mahindra Bolero Power+ gets seatbelts, ABS and airbags as standard features along with the anti-theft system. Higher variants include central locking, child safety lock, ISOFIX Child Seat Mounts and rear wash wiper. The power steering along with the drum brakes at the rear make the Bolero+ a safe SUV. The SUV is built on a rock-solid body-on-frame chassis and a sturdy structure to withstand any impact. The suspension is designed to withstand rough surfaces. The Bolero+ is meant to be easily repairable and maintainable making it a safe choice for rough roads.

The Mahindra Bolero Power+ is available in four variants. The LX is the base variant which starts at Rs.07.49 Lakhs. It  gets standard features like ABS, driver airbags, anti-theft system, digital cluster and vinyl fabric seats. The SLE starts at Rs.07.86 lakhs. It  gets an AC, wheel caps and remote fuel lid opener in addition to power steering. The SLX variant starts at Rs.08.51 lakhs. It  gets a CD player, centre armrest on second-row seats, power windows and keyless entry. The ZLX is the top of the line variant which starts at Rs.08.86 lakhs. It  gets the Micro Hybrid System, Driver Information System and Exterior body graphics among other features.
